Entries.default: "My old captain was a drinker from the day he was born to the day he died."
"He wound up with a wooden leg, twenty-six ships, and bilious fever."
"Sunrise is a woe, doves. The coming horizon is a sea-sized ruin."
The pirate cuts a glance to the side, and a bout of jaunty music rackets up.
She bobs her head to the beat.
"'Put down anchor, breed, and don't loot so much.'"
"But when should we lot, where, and how could we settle?"
"Drink s'more, doves, and you may sober up, sinking Eora's last ship, three stars before the burning."
"The morning is a blight, lovesome. The morrow is a pus-filled boil."
